verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye be come into the land of your habitations, which I give unto you,
verses.ct: "Talk to the people of Israel and tell them: When you arrive in the land where you will settle, which I am giving to you,

verses.kjv: And will make an offering by fire unto the LORD, a burnt offering, or a sacrifice in performing a vow, or in a freewill offering, or in your solemn feasts, to make a sweet savour unto the LORD, of the herd, or of the flock:
verses.ct: and you present a fire offering to the LORD — whether a burnt offering or a sacrifice to fulfill a vow, or a voluntary offering, or an offering during your appointed festivals — producing an aroma pleasing to the LORD from your cattle or your flocks,

verses.kjv: Then shall he that offereth his offering unto the LORD bring a meat offering of a tenth deal of flour mingled with the fourth part of an hin of oil.
verses.ct: then the person presenting the offering to the LORD must also bring a grain offering of one-tenth of an ephah of flour mixed with a quarter of a hin of oil.

verses.kjv: And the fourth part of an hin of wine for a drink offering shalt thou prepare with the burnt offering or sacrifice, for one lamb.
verses.ct: You must also prepare a quarter of a hin of wine as a drink offering to go with the burnt offering or sacrifice for each lamb.

verses.kjv: Or for a ram, thou shalt prepare for a meat offering two tenth deals of flour mingled with the third part of an hin of oil.
verses.ct: For a ram, you must prepare a grain offering of two-tenths of an ephah of flour mixed with a third of a hin of oil.

verses.kjv: And for a drink offering thou shalt offer the third part of an hin of wine, for a sweet savour unto the LORD.
verses.ct: You must also present a third of a hin of wine as a drink offering, producing an aroma pleasing to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And when thou preparest a bullock for a burnt offering, or for a sacrifice in performing a vow, or peace offerings unto the LORD:
verses.ct: When you prepare a bull as a burnt offering, or as a sacrifice to fulfill a vow, or as a peace offering to the LORD,

verses.kjv: Then shall he bring with a bullock a meat offering of three tenth deals of flour mingled with half an hin of oil.
verses.ct: then a grain offering of three-tenths of an ephah of flour mixed with half a hin of oil must be brought along with the bull.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt bring for a drink offering half an hin of wine, for an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD.
verses.ct: You must also bring half a hin of wine as a drink offering. This is a fire offering that produces an aroma pleasing to the LORD.

verses.kjv: Thus shall it be done for one bullock, or for one ram, or for a lamb, or a kid.
verses.ct: These are the amounts required for each bull, each ram, each lamb, or each young goat.

verses.kjv: According to the number that ye shall prepare, so shall ye do to every one according to their number.
verses.ct: However many animals you prepare, follow these same proportions for each one.

verses.kjv: All that are born of the country shall do these things after this manner, in offering an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD.
verses.ct: Every native-born Israelite must follow these instructions when presenting a fire offering that produces an aroma pleasing to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And if a stranger sojourn with you, or whosoever be among you in your generations, and will offer an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD; as ye do, so he shall do.
verses.ct: If a foreigner living among you, or anyone else among you in future generations, wants to present a fire offering that produces an aroma pleasing to the LORD, they must do exactly what you do.

verses.kjv: One ordinance shall be both for you of the congregation, and also for the stranger that sojourneth with you, an ordinance for ever in your generations: as ye are, so shall the stranger be before the LORD.
verses.ct: The same regulation applies to both you and the foreigner living among you. This is a permanent rule for all your generations. In the LORD's presence, you and the foreigner are treated the same.

verses.kjv: One law and one manner shall be for you, and for the stranger that sojourneth with you.
verses.ct: The same law and the same standards apply to both you and the foreigner living among you."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye come into the land whither I bring you,
verses.ct: "Talk to the people of Israel and tell them: When you enter the land where I am bringing you,

verses.kjv: Then it shall be, that, when ye eat of the bread of the land, ye shall offer up an heave offering unto the LORD.
verses.ct: and you eat food produced from that land, you must set aside a contribution for the LORD.

verses.kjv: Ye shall offer up a cake of the first of your dough for an heave offering: as ye do the heave offering of the threshingfloor, so shall ye heave it.
verses.ct: You must present a loaf from the first batch of your dough as a contribution, just as you present a contribution from your threshing floor.

verses.kjv: Of the first of your dough ye shall give unto the LORD an heave offering in your generations.
verses.ct: Throughout all your generations, you must give the LORD a contribution from the first of your dough.

verses.kjv: And if ye have erred, and not observed all these commandments, which the LORD hath spoken unto Moses,
verses.ct: Now, if you unintentionally fail to keep any of these commands that the LORD gave through Moses —

verses.kjv: Even all that the LORD hath commanded you by the hand of Moses, from the day that the LORD commanded Moses, and henceforward among your generations;
verses.ct: everything the LORD instructed you through Moses, from the day the LORD first gave these commands and continuing through all your future generations —

verses.kjv: Then it shall be, if ought be committed by ignorance without the knowledge of the congregation, that all the congregation shall offer one young bullock for a burnt offering, for a sweet savour unto the LORD, with his meat offering, and his drink offering, according to the manner, and one kid of the goats for a sin offering.
verses.ct: and if the sin was committed unintentionally without the community being aware of it, then the entire community must offer one young bull as a burnt offering producing an aroma pleasing to the LORD, along with its required grain offering and drink offering, plus one male goat as a sin offering.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall make an atonement for all the congregation of the children of Israel, and it shall be forgiven them; for it is ignorance: and they shall bring their offering, a sacrifice made by fire unto the LORD, and their sin offering before the LORD, for their ignorance:
verses.ct: The priest must perform atonement for the entire community of the people of Israel, and they will be forgiven. Since it was an unintentional sin, they must bring their fire offering to the LORD and their sin offering in the LORD's presence for their unintentional failure.

verses.kjv: And it shall be forgiven all the congregation of the children of Israel, and the stranger that sojourneth among them; seeing all the people were in ignorance.
verses.ct: The entire community of the people of Israel will be forgiven, along with any foreigners living among them, since all the people were involved in the unintentional sin.

verses.kjv: And if any soul sin through ignorance, then he shall bring a she goat of the first year for a sin offering.
verses.ct: If an individual sins unintentionally, that person must bring a 1-year-old female goat as a sin offering.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall make an atonement for the soul that sinneth ignorantly, when he sinneth by ignorance before the LORD, to make an atonement for him; and it shall be forgiven him.
verses.ct: The priest must perform atonement in the LORD's presence for the person who sinned unintentionally, and that person will be forgiven.

verses.kjv: Ye shall have one law for him that sinneth through ignorance, both for him that is born among the children of Israel, and for the stranger that sojourneth among them.
verses.ct: The same law regarding unintentional sin applies to everyone — whether a native-born Israelite or a foreigner living among you.

verses.kjv: But the soul that doeth ought presumptuously, whether he be born in the land, or a stranger, the same reproacheth the LORD; and that soul shall be cut off from among his people.
verses.ct: But anyone who sins deliberately, whether native-born or a foreigner, insults the LORD. That person must be removed from their people.

verses.kjv: Because he hath despised the word of the LORD, and hath broken his commandment, that soul shall utterly be cut off; his iniquity shall be upon him.
verses.ct: Because that person has treated the LORD's word with contempt and violated his command, they must be completely removed. Their guilt remains on them."

verses.kjv: And while the children of Israel were in the wilderness, they found a man that gathered sticks upon the sabbath day.
verses.ct: While the people of Israel were in the wilderness, they discovered a man collecting firewood on the Sabbath day.

verses.kjv: And they that found him gathering sticks brought him unto Moses and Aaron, and unto all the congregation.
verses.ct: Those who caught him collecting wood brought him to Moses, Aaron, and the whole community.

verses.kjv: And they put him in ward, because it was not declared what should be done to him.
verses.ct: They held him in custody because it had not yet been determined what should be done with him.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, The man shall be surely put to death: all the congregation shall stone him with stones without the camp.
verses.ct: Then the LORD told Moses, "This man must be executed. The entire community must stone him outside the camp."

verses.kjv: And all the congregation brought him without the camp, and stoned him with stones, and he died; as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: So the entire community took him outside the camp and stoned him to death, just as the LORD had commanded Moses.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto the children of Israel, and bid them that they make them fringes in the borders of their garments throughout their generations, and that they put upon the fringe of the borders a ribband of blue:
verses.ct: "Talk to the people of Israel and instruct them to make tassels on the corners of their clothing throughout all their generations, with a blue cord attached to each tassel.

verses.kjv: And it shall be unto you for a fringe, that ye may look upon it, and remember all the commandments of the LORD, and do them; and that ye seek not after your own heart and your own eyes, after which ye use to go a whoring:
verses.ct: These tassels will serve as a reminder for you. Whenever you see them, you will remember all the LORD's commands and obey them, instead of chasing after whatever your own hearts and eyes desire, which leads you to be unfaithful.

verses.kjv: That ye may remember, and do all my commandments, and be holy unto your God.
verses.ct: This way you will remember and follow all my commands and be set apart for your God.

verses.kjv: I am the LORD your God, which brought you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God: I am the LORD your God.
verses.ct: I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of Egypt to be your God. I am the LORD your God."
